intro: Adesmia tristis, commonly known as the narrowleaf burrpea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its seed pods are hairy and contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Adesmia tristis is often found in sandy soils and is considered a hardy, low-maintenance plant.
